interestingFact: There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 United Nations member states and 2 observer states.
India is the most populous country in the world, with over 1.3 billion people.
The Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world, standing at 828 meters (2,717 feet).
Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the largest coral reef system in the world.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
The Eiffel Tower in Paris was once the tallest man-made structure in the world.
Russia is the largest country in the world by area, covering more than 17 million square kilometers.
The Great Wall of China is visible from space on rare occasions. It stretches over 13,000 miles.
Japan consists of over 6,800 islands, with four main islands: Honshu, Hokkaido, Kyushu, and Shikoku.
South Africa is known as the 'Rainbow Nation' due to its diverse cultures and languages, with 11 official languages.
The UK is made up of four countries: England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland. Each has its own distinct culture and traditions. Cricket is a popular sport in the UK.
The United States is the third largest country in the world by both area and population. It has a diverse landscape, ranging from the Grand Canyon to the Great Lakes.
